page.title: 03Quenington
page.content: {Quenington}is an old village on the edge of the Cotswolds,it has almost five hundred inhabitants.The original village lies on the banks of the River Coln. The houses built since 1850 have been built away from the river. The reason for this move to higher ground is that during the winter the river floods.An unexpected bonus of this flooding is that it provides the children with a natural skating rink. At the centre of the village is Quenington Court, an old Crusaders Commandery,two mills dating back to Saxon times and a Saxon Church.
